intro: Babiana ambigua, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spiky stems that bear bright orange to red flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen throughout the year. Babiana ambigua is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
